alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, Bay and Walton. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 7 and 10 inches of rain have fallen in the last 6 Hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa Beach, Seaside, Seagrove Beach, Grayton Beach, Port Washington, Blue Mountain Beach, Bunker, Inlet Beach, Four Mile Village, Hollywood Beach, Laguna Beach, Sandestin, Sunnyside, Gulf Pines and Miramar Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
